core

Class ResourcesManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.DatabaseManager
      • core.ResourcesManager

  • public class ResourcesManager
extends DatabaseManager
    Handle all the accesses to the SQLite database for the resources.
    Author:
    Paul Chaignon

    • Method Detail

      • getResources

        public static java.util.Set<Resource> getResources(boolean active)
        Get the resources from the database.
        Parameters:
        active - If true then this method will only return the active resources.
        Returns:
        All resources from the database.

      • addResource

        public static Resource addResource(Resource resource)
        Add a resource to the database and set the resource id with the one used in the sql table
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource to add.
        Returns:
        The resource added with the id set or null if an error occurred.

      • removeResource

        public static boolean removeResource(Resource resource)
        Remove a resource from the database.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource to remove.
        Returns:
        True if the operation succeed, false otherwise.

      • removeResources

        public static java.util.Set<Resource> removeResources(java.util.Set<Resource> resources)
        Remove resources from the database.
        Parameters:
        resources - The resources to remove.
        Returns:
        The resources that weren't removed.

      • updateResource

        public static boolean updateResource(Resource resource)
        Update a resource in the database. All fields except the URI can be updated.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource to update.
        Returns:
        True if the update succeed, false otherwise.

      • updateResourcesTrust

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> updateResourcesTrust(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> resourceInvolvements,
                                                    int gameResult)
        Update the trust parameter of resources.
        Parameters:
        resourceInvolvements - A map with the id of the resources as key and the value that need to be add to the trust of the resource.
        gameResult - The result of the game: -1 for lose, 1 for win, 0 for draw.
        Returns:
        The id of the resources that weren't updated.

      • updateResourcesActive

        public static java.util.Set<Resource> updateResourcesActive(java.util.Set<Resource> resources)
        Update the active parameter of resources.
        Parameters:
        resources - The resources whose active parameter is to update.
        Returns:
        The resources that weren't updated.
